newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares close lower on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: KL shares close lower on profit-taking.

text.p: Malaysian shares closed lower as investors locked in profits posted on Wednesday.
Analysts said trading was likely to remain choppy until after the U.S. Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) interest rate policy meeting next Tuesday.
"People are waiting for the FOMC meeting to get out of the way though some have discounted it," said an analyst with a foreign brokerage house. "The market is still attractive."
The benchmark Composite Index of 100 large-capitalised stocks ended down 8.84 points at 1,225.99, while the all-share EMAS index closed 2.58 points lower at 359.17.
Market volume stood at 376 million shares, compared with 405 million on Wednesday. Losers overwhelmed gainers 509 to 135.
United Engineers fell 70 cents to 22.30 ringgit. After the close, the company announced a net profit of 513.2 million ringgit, up 90 percent from the previous year.
Trenergy dropped 35 cents to 9.60 ringgit on profit-taking. The stock had risen over the past week on speculation that the company had won an oil and gas contract in an eastern Malaysian state.
